Olajumoke Evangelina Owokotomo is a doctoral researcher at the Intervisity institute of biostatistics and statistical bioinformatics, universiteit Hasselt, Belgium. Her research focuses on the developement of biomarker for high-dimensional omics data such as microbiome data, metabolic data, gene expression data, etc.
Currently she is working on developing a new measure of surrogacy that can be applied to various endpoint using the Bayesian variable approach . The measure is a probability measure that tells the probability of how important is the biomarker is for the endpoint of interest.

content: R Software  R is a statistical software that can be used to provide meaniful informaion (computing and graphics) about dataset in any format. It is freely available online and it can run on any platform (dont be worried if you use a mac or unix platform). R is always available in different version, always use the latest version. R can be downloaded from the Comprehensive R Archive Network.  Click the download R on the second line and choose a CRAN mirror to download. It is recommended to choose the CRAN mirror close to your country.  Some functionality in R are organized in packages which contain several functions. mean() is a function in R that calulate the mean of several observations. n() is a function in the dplyr package that gives the number of observations in a group and the format of represenation in R is dplyr::n().  R Studio  R studio is is an open source software for R. It is always recommended to use R studio in other to fully understand and use all its functionality using the R syntax. R studio can be used for various purposes as we will see over time. R studio provide a good platform for the use of of R software through it user interface. The latest version of R studio for different platform can be downloaded Here.  R Markdown  R markdown is one tte cool features of R studio that enables your project to be reproduceable. R markdown can be used to generate your report in any format. A single R markdown file nicely combines your code for analysis and the some texts to generate your report. R markdown is free and open source and it is apackage in R. When you open an R session, R markdown can be installed using install.packages("rmarkdown").  Git/Github  Git is an open-source version control system. Version control systems manage the revisions made on your project or documents in a central repository. Git is the mostly used version control because it stores project or file changes efficiently. Git is a command line tool central around the github. Github is a place to store your projects and track the changes made to the project. Each project files are stored in a repository. Register for an account on GitHub. Download Git here. Open Git bash on your PC and run the following commands.  git config --global user.name "your_GitHub_Username_here" git config --global user.mail "your_email_here"

content:
The R package MetabolicSurv identifies metabolic biomarker signature for cancer patients (metabolic risk score) for metabolic data by discovering predictive metabolite for predicting survival and classifying patients into low and high risk group for mortality. Metabolic risk scores (classifiers) are constructed as a linear combination of predictive/important metabolites, prognostic factors and treatment effects if necessary.
Several methods were implemented to estimate the metabolic risk score such as majority voting technique, LASSO, Elastic net, Supervised Principle component analysis and Supervised Partial least squares analysis. All estimation methods were evaluated within a $\ell$-fold cross-validation loop. During the evaluation process, validation is accessed using the hazard ratios (HR) distribution of the test set. Resampling based inference is implemented using permutations technique.
Download the MetabolicSurv here
summary: A Biomarker Validation approach for Classification and Predicting Survival Using Metabolomic Signature.
title: MetabolicSurv R Package

Welcome to Slides Academic
Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides  Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E  Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")  Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = \;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears  Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view   Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links   night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links  Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}  Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }  Questions? Ask
